intro: Galium trachyspermum var. miltorrhizum, commonly known as Indian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is native to parts of Asia, including India and China, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional systems of medicine.
